page.title: 02APPLETON ROEBUCK LANDSCAPE
page.content: The{land}is low lying and undulating rising gently northwards from 8 metres at Bolton Percy and 9 metres at Appleton Roebuck to 15 metres at Brumber Hill and Colton Bridge. Sparse{settlement}is focussed on two villages,Appleton Roebuck,Bolton Percy and the hamlets of Holme Green and Colton Bridge.Population is approximately 1000. Surface{drainage}is by many ditches and land drains which connect to two natural becks,the{ "the Foss" }which flows to the west and south of Bolton and{ "the Fleet"} which passes to the east of Appleton. Both streams are tributaries of{"the Wharfe"}which they join at Nun Appleton and are subject to winter flooding, though the Fleet has been widened and deepened. The surface rock is Boulder Clay and has poor natural drainage.
